result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Possess w/ Intent to Deliver Methamphetamine(>50g)
Possession w/ Intent to Deliver Schedule III Controlled Substance (Buprenorphine)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark R. Endl

defendant.name: Endl, Mark R.
defendant.address: Regency Inn 1828 S Hastings Way, Eau Claire, WI 54701

records.addlTxt:
Amending Count 2 to Possession w/ Intent to Deliver Schedule III Controlled Substance (Buprenorphine). 
Amending Count 3 to Possession of Drug Paraphernalia.

(2:10 PM case called.) Prosecuting District Attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Mark R. Endl does not appear in court or via Zoom. Attorney James H Krave in court for Mark R. Endl. 
State notes the defendant is not present and has a witness here and is ready to proceed.
Attorney Krave advises received a call from his office who received a call from the defendant who advised has a flat tire but may be on his way.
(2:15 PM case re-called.) Prosecuting District Attorney Peter J. Rindal in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Mark R. Endl in court. Attorney James H Krave in court for Mark R. Endl.
Parties advise are ready to proceed.
State calls Officer Tyler Larsen of the Eau Claire Police Department, who is sworn and testifies.
Attorney Krave advises has no questions. Witness excused.
Court finds probable cause and binds the matter over.
Attorney Krave to schedule an Arraignment with the Branch 1 Judicial Assistant.

Conditions:
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.

11:13 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Kelly Ronquist in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Mark R. Endl appeared by video, in custody with attorney Kate Cook. 
Defense waives reading of the complaint and time limits for the preliminary hearing. Defendant eligible for SPD representation. State requests $4,000 cash bond- defense objects to high cash bond. Court orders $4000 cash bond. A preliminary hearing is scheduled for 7-19-22 at 1:30 PM.

Conditions:
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services with possible testing based on monitoring level.
